Cherry blossom season in Japan is a wonderful time to visit! However, I think there might be some misunderstanding - cherry blossom season in Japan typically lasts around 2-4 weeks, not just 4 days.

Cherry blossom season, also known as "Hanami" in Japanese, usually takes place from late March to early April, with the exact timing varying from year to year depending on weather conditions. The blooming period can last anywhere from 2-4 weeks, with the peak blooming period usually occurring around 1-2 weeks.

If you're planning to visit Japan during cherry blossom season, I recommend checking the forecasts and planning your trip accordingly. Many travel websites and apps provide cherry blossom forecasts, and you can also check with your travel agent or tour operator for advice.

Additionally, keep in mind that cherry blossom season is a very popular time to visit Japan, and popular destinations like Tokyo, Kyoto, and Osaka can get quite crowded. It's a good idea to book your accommodations and transportation in advance to avoid any inconvenience.

If you have any more questions about visiting Japan during cherry blossom season, feel free to ask!
